metadata.Title: CVE-2015-7298 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
ownCloud Desktop Client before 2.0.1, when compiled with a Qt release after 5.3.x, does not call QNetworkReply::ignoreSslErrors with the list of errors to be ignored, which makes it easier for remote attackers to conduct man-in-the-middle (MITM) attacks by leveraging a server using a self-signed certificate.  NOTE: this vulnerability exists because of a partial CVE-2015-4456 regression.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-7298` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

caja-owncloud - 2.1.1+dfsg-1ubuntu1.1
dolphin-owncloud - 2.1.1+dfsg-1ubuntu1.1
libowncloudsync0 - 2.1.1+dfsg-1ubuntu1.1
nautilus-owncloud - 2.1.1+dfsg-1ubuntu1.1
nemo-owncloud - 2.1.1+dfsg-1ubuntu1.1
owncloud-client - 2.1.1+dfsg-1ubuntu1.1
owncloud-client-cmd - 2.1.1+dfsg-1ubuntu1.1
owncloud-client-data - 2.1.1+dfsg-1ubuntu1.1
owncloud-client-l10n - 2.1.1+dfsg-1ubuntu1.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: owncloud-client package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.1.1+dfsg-1ubuntu1.1').
